page.title: 05Blackers Hill near Emborough
page.content: High above the valley called 'Crocks Bottom' stands the ramparts of Blackers Hill Camp, a prehistoric earthwork which may have served to guard the Fosse Way from the west. Only parts of the ramparts and dyke can now be traced mainly on the north and western edges. part of he hill was known as 'Fairey slats' but unfortunately the reason for this has been lost. Close to the earthwork is Blackers Hill Farm. A seventeenth century house which until recently had been let to fall into bad repair. In the last few years however it has been successfully repaired an modernised. The area is full of evidence of occupations through many centuries, it is good to see some people still remain.
